alert.note: Alert for Foothills of the Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued December 25 at 6:12AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...MODERATE RAINALL TO BRING RISES ON STREAMS AND RIVERS THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK... A storm will bring moderate to heavy rainfall beginning Monday and continuing through Tuesday night. Two to three inches of rain is expected over the Cascades and one to two inches of rain is expected over the Blue Mountains. This rainfall, combined with warmer temperatures will lead to higher snow levels and increased snowmelt and runoff. As a result, many stream and rivers will experience in-banks rises, but at this time no flooding is anticipated. However, if more rainfall is received than expected, or temperatures are warmer, there could be minor flooding of streams and low lying areas and there could be some ponding of water on roadways. While we know that temperatures will be warmer than they have been and much warmer than normal for the start of the week, confidence is below average on exactly how warm they will get. A second system is expected to move across the area Wednesday night into Thursday. However, cooler temperatures will bring lower snow levels and should therefore allow for most of the precipitation that falls in the mountains to be snow. As a result, additional runoff from this system is expected to be minimal at this time.

area.areaDesc: Foothills of the Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon
